scope.description: Baseline engineering requirements library (superset) for steam generators used in nuclear facilities. Applicability is filtered by an SGProfile and project licensing basis.
scope.licensing_basis_assumption: US NRC-style framework (10 CFR Part 50/52) with code-of-record per 10 CFR 50.55a where applicable.
notes: This library is intentionally a superset. Not every requirement applies to every steam generator type (U-tube recirculating, once-through, helical-coil).
Clause-level traceability (e.g., exact ASME/NRC clause IDs) is expected to be added once the standards database is ingested and indexed.

This is a PARTIAL baseline intended for iterative refinement; additional requirement sets (ISI access details, EQ, commissioning, operations/chemistry expansions, ALARA, procurement depth) can be appended without changing schema.

requirements.text: The project shall define and record the licensing basis and code-of-record for the steam generator (SG), including applicable regulations, incorporated codes/standards, and edition/addenda where required.

verification.acceptance: A controlled licensing-basis and code-of-record record exists for the SG.

requirements.text: The project shall assign the SG safety classification, code class, and seismic category, and shall document the basis for these assignments.

verification.acceptance: Classification records exist and align with plant licensing basis and system safety functions.

requirements.text: The project shall identify SG safety functions and supporting performance requirements (including accident analysis assumptions where applicable) and maintain traceability from functions to design and program controls.

verification.acceptance: Traceability from safety functions to design/program requirements is documented and under configuration control.

requirements.text: Design inputs (loads, pressures, temperatures, duty, transients, chemistry limits, inspection/repair strategy) used for SG design shall be controlled and verified prior to use.

verification.acceptance: Design inputs are identified, reviewed, approved, and version-controlled.

requirements.text: The SG requirements set shall be captured in a controlled requirements baseline and changes shall be processed through formal configuration management.

verification.acceptance: A requirements baseline exists; changes show review, approval, and impact assessment.

requirements.text: The project shall perform and document an independent design review for the SG design package (calculations, drawings, specifications, and analyses) commensurate with safety classification.

verification.acceptance: Independent design review records exist and dispositions are closed.

requirements.text: The project shall define design life and design transients/cycles for the SG and use them consistently across fatigue, thermal-hydraulic, and tube integrity programs.

verification.acceptance: Design life and transient definitions are documented and consistently referenced across analyses and programs.

requirements.text: A documented SG aging management approach shall be established to ensure continued fulfillment of intended functions for the defined design life, including monitoring, inspection, and corrective actions.

verification.acceptance: An aging management plan exists with defined monitoring/inspection activities and acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: The procurement specification for the SG shall define technical, QA, and documentation requirements, including required records, data packages, and hold points.

verification.acceptance: Procurement specification includes technical requirements, QA clauses, and deliverable list with acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Supplier qualification and oversight activities shall be established for SG design and fabrication suppliers, including audits and surveillance appropriate to safety classification.

verification.acceptance: Supplier qualification records exist; audit/surveillance plans and reports are available.

requirements.text: Commercial-grade dedication activities (if used) shall be defined for SG subcomponents/materials and shall provide reasonable assurance that critical characteristics are met.

verification.acceptance: Dedication plans identify critical characteristics, verification methods, and acceptance evidence.

requirements.text: The project shall define acceptance test requirements for the SG (factory and site), including required test conditions, instrumentation, and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Acceptance test plan exists with test matrix and pass/fail criteria.

requirements.text: A nonconformance control process shall be applied to SG design/fabrication deviations, including evaluation, disposition, and records retention.

verification.acceptance: Nonconformance reports show technical evaluation, disposition authority, and closure evidence.

requirements.text: A corrective action program interface shall be established for SG issues discovered during fabrication, testing, operation, or inspection, including cause evaluation and preventive actions where required.

verification.acceptance: Corrective action records exist and include cause evaluation and effectiveness checks as applicable.

requirements.text: The project shall define SG records retention requirements (including tube inspection data and repair records) for the life of the plant or as required by the licensing basis.

verification.acceptance: Records retention requirements are documented and implemented in records management processes.

requirements.text: The project shall define an SG foreign material exclusion (FME) program for fabrication, shipment, installation, and outage activities affecting the SG.

verification.acceptance: FME program procedures exist and include barriers, controls, and verification steps.

requirements.text: Interfaces between the SG program and plant programs (chemistry, IST/OM, ISI, radiation protection, maintenance, operations) shall be identified and controlled.

verification.acceptance: Interface control documentation exists and responsibilities are assigned.

requirements.text: Analysis and calculation tools used for SG design and integrity assessments shall be qualified or validated commensurate with their safety significance.

verification.acceptance: Tool qualification/validation records exist and define applicability, limitations, and configuration control.

requirements.text: The SG shall have a documented operational leakage limit and associated action levels consistent with tube integrity program commitments.

verification.acceptance: Leakage limits and action levels are documented and traceable to tube integrity program requirements.

requirements.text: The SG program shall define tube repair/plugging strategy and associated engineering evaluation requirements prior to implementation.

verification.acceptance: Repair strategy and evaluation process are documented; approvals are defined.

requirements.text: The project shall define design basis events and performance expectations for the SG (normal, upset, emergency, faulted) and align design limits accordingly.

verification.acceptance: Design basis event set and corresponding limits are documented and used in analyses/specifications.

requirements.text: The project shall define a maintainability strategy for the SG including access, tooling, and outage scope assumptions necessary to meet required inspection/repair intervals.

verification.acceptance: Maintainability plan identifies access provisions and tooling assumptions for inspection and repair.

requirements.text: The project shall define minimum documentation deliverables for the SG, including drawings, specifications, certified material test reports, NDE records, and test reports.

verification.acceptance: Vendor data package requirements are defined and include acceptance evidence for each deliverable.

requirements.text: The project shall establish a configuration baseline for SG as-built data (materials, weld maps, tube maps, support maps, clearances) to support lifetime inspection and evaluation.

verification.acceptance: As-built data baseline exists, is complete, and is retained under document control.

requirements.text: The project shall capture and disposition applicable operating experience and lessons learned related to SG tube degradation mechanisms, chemistry, and FIV.

verification.acceptance: An operating experience review record exists and resulting actions are tracked to closure.

requirements.text: The SG shall define and maintain boundary/interface drawings identifying the primary and secondary pressure boundaries, including connected piping, nozzles, and isolation devices.

verification.acceptance: Boundary/interface drawings exist and clearly identify boundaries and interfaces.

requirements.text: The SG primary-side nozzle locations, sizes, and end preparations shall be specified to ensure compatibility with reactor coolant system piping and weld procedures.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle interface specifications match connected piping requirements and weld details.

requirements.text: The SG secondary-side feedwater and main steam nozzle locations, sizes, and end preparations shall be specified to ensure compatibility with balance-of-plant piping design.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle interface specifications match BOP piping requirements and weld details.

requirements.text: Allowable external loads and moments at all SG nozzles shall be defined and communicated for piping stress analyses; the SG design shall accommodate these loads with appropriate margins.

verification.acceptance: Allowable nozzle load tables exist and are referenced by piping stress analyses.

requirements.text: The SG support system (skirt/lugs/frame) shall be designed to transmit deadweight, thermal, seismic, and dynamic loads to the building structure without exceeding allowable stresses or support capacities.

verification.acceptance: Support design calculations demonstrate compliance for all governing load combinations.

requirements.text: The SG layout shall provide required clearances for installation and removal of manway covers, channel head components, and inspection tooling.

verification.acceptance: Layout drawings demonstrate required access clearances for intended maintenance/inspection activities.

requirements.text: The SG shall provide vents, drains, and sampling connections necessary for startup, shutdown, layup, hydrotesting, and chemistry control of both primary and secondary sides.

verification.acceptance: P&IDs identify required vents/drains/sampling points with isolation and provisions for safe use.

requirements.text: The SG secondary blowdown interface shall be defined, including capacity, chemistry sampling, and heat recovery interfaces if applicable.

verification.acceptance: Blowdown interface definition exists and matches plant design basis for chemistry control and heat recovery.

requirements.text: The SG instrumentation list shall define required measurements and ranges (e.g., level, pressure, temperature, differential pressure, leak detection) and shall ensure compatibility with plant I&C architecture.

verification.acceptance: Instrument index and I/O requirements exist and are consistent with plant I&C design.

requirements.text: Where digital instrumentation is used, the SG I&C design shall define signal quality, grounding/shielding, and data integrity requirements to prevent spurious signals affecting protection or control functions.

verification.acceptance: I&C design documentation includes signal integrity requirements and verification evidence.

requirements.text: The SG shall include provisions to support primary-to-secondary leak detection and trending, including defined measurement methods and expected detection sensitivity.

verification.acceptance: Leak detection method and expected sensitivity are documented and traceable to operational requirements.

requirements.text: The SG shall define interface requirements for secondary overpressure protection devices (safety/relief valves), including setpoints, capacity, discharge routing, and qualification requirements.

verification.acceptance: Protection device interface requirements are documented and compatible with plant design.

requirements.text: The SG shall define requirements for insulation and lagging (if used), including removability for inspection and compatibility with design temperature and radiological controls.

verification.acceptance: Insulation specification defines materials, removability, and temperature ratings.

requirements.text: The SG shall define lifting, rigging, and handling interfaces including lift points, center of gravity, and permitted lift configurations for fabrication, shipment, and installation.

verification.acceptance: Handling and rigging specifications/drawings exist and include load ratings and lift procedures.

requirements.text: The SG shall define shipping and preservation interfaces, including moisture control, cleanliness protection, and inspection upon receipt.

verification.acceptance: Shipping/preservation requirements exist and receiving inspection criteria are defined.

requirements.text: Interfaces for foreign object barriers and FME controls during outages shall be defined for both primary and secondary sides, including attachment points and coverage areas.

verification.acceptance: Barrier/interface requirements are defined and support planned FME controls.

requirements.text: The SG shall define interfaces for sludge lancing and secondary side cleaning systems where applicable, including access ports and flow paths.

verification.acceptance: Design includes defined access ports and connections for sludge lancing/cleaning where required.

requirements.text: The SG shall define allowable thermal expansion and differential expansion interface constraints with connected piping and supports, including required sliding surfaces or flexibilities.

verification.acceptance: Thermal expansion analyses show compatibility with connected piping/support assumptions.

requirements.text: The SG shall define seismic interface requirements, including anchorage design inputs, interaction with nearby equipment, and required clearances to prevent impact during seismic events.

verification.acceptance: Seismic interface documentation exists and includes clearances and interaction checks.

requirements.text: The SG shall define interface requirements for inservice inspection (ISI) and tube inspection access, including manway sizes, tooling paths, and access constraints.

verification.acceptance: Access provisions support intended inspection scope and tooling; constraints are documented.

requirements.text: The SG shall define interface requirements for primary-side maintenance activities such as channel head decontamination, gasket replacement, and inspection staging.

verification.acceptance: Maintenance procedures can be supported by physical access and required provisions.

requirements.text: The SG shall define requirements for chemical addition and sampling interfaces for secondary chemistry control (e.g., ammonia/ETA, oxygen scavenger as applicable), including compatibility with plant practices.

verification.acceptance: Chemistry interface requirements are documented and consistent with the chemistry program.

requirements.text: The SG shall provide or interface with loose parts monitoring and foreign object management processes as applicable to support prevention and mitigation of tube wear events.

verification.acceptance: Loose parts/FOSAR interface requirements are defined and integrated into outage processes.

requirements.text: The SG shall define functional interface requirements for startup and shutdown operations, including heatup/cooldown limits, venting, draining, and minimum secondary inventory as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Operational interface requirements are documented and incorporated into procedures.

requirements.text: The SG shall define requirements for secondary side isolation capability and valve alignment (where applicable) to support accident mitigation strategies credited in safety analyses.

verification.acceptance: Isolation requirements are documented and traceable to safety analysis assumptions.

requirement_sets.category: 3. Thermal performance, heat transfer, and operating envelope

requirements.text: The SG shall be designed to meet or exceed rated thermal duty at rated primary and secondary conditions while maintaining required margins to tube and boundary limits.

verification.acceptance: Thermal-hydraulic design calculations demonstrate rated duty capability with defined margins.

requirements.text: The SG shall provide rated steam flow at rated main steam pressure and temperature with specified feedwater conditions and blowdown flows.

verification.acceptance: Performance model demonstrates rated steam generation under specified boundary conditions.

requirements.text: The SG shall meet minimum steam quality and maximum moisture carryover limits over the defined operating envelope, including load-following where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Predicted and/or tested steam quality and carryover are within specified limits.

requirements.text: The SG shall define and satisfy allowable primary-side pressure drop limits to avoid adverse impacts on reactor coolant system flow and pump head requirements.

verification.acceptance: Calculated primary-side pressure drop is below the specified maximum across operating conditions.

requirements.text: The SG shall define and satisfy allowable secondary-side pressure drop limits to avoid adverse impacts on turbine and feedwater system performance.

verification.acceptance: Calculated secondary-side pressure drop is below the specified maximum across operating conditions.

requirements.text: The SG heat transfer design shall include a fouling factor allowance and demonstrate acceptable performance at end-of-cycle or bounding fouling conditions.

verification.acceptance: Performance model includes fouling factor; required duty is met with fouling applied.

requirements.text: The SG shall define an operating envelope (pressures, temperatures, flows, levels) and associated trip/protection setpoints or operating limits needed to prevent dryout, instability, or boundary exceedances.

verification.acceptance: Operating envelope documentation exists and limiting conditions are identified with associated controls/protections.

requirements.text: For U-tube recirculating SGs, the design shall provide sufficient natural recirculation to maintain heat transfer and avoid local dryout under normal and anticipated operational occurrences.

verification.acceptance: Recirculation analysis demonstrates margins to dryout and acceptable void fraction/quality profiles.

requirements.text: For once-through SGs, the design shall maintain stable boiling/heat transfer across the economizer/evaporator regions for the defined operating envelope and transients.

verification.acceptance: Stability and heat transfer analyses demonstrate acceptable margins and no unacceptable oscillations.

requirements.text: For helical-coil SGs, the design shall demonstrate stable thermal-hydraulic performance and acceptable pressure drop across helical-coil circuits over the operating envelope.

verification.acceptance: Thermal-hydraulic model shows stable operation and pressure drops within limits for helical coil configuration.

requirements.text: The SG shall define and verify approach temperature limits and minimum subcooling margins on the primary side under rated and limiting conditions.

verification.acceptance: Approach temperature and subcooling calculations show compliance with specified margins.

requirements.text: The SG shall be designed to tolerate defined load ramp rates and step changes without exceeding thermal stress, level, or pressure limits.

verification.acceptance: Transient analyses demonstrate compliance for defined ramp/step events.

requirements.text: The SG shall define allowable heatup and cooldown rates consistent with fatigue and thermal stress limits of the pressure boundaries and tube-to-tubesheet joints.

verification.acceptance: Heatup/cooldown limits are calculated and documented; operating procedures incorporate them.

requirements.text: The SG shall include provisions to manage secondary inventory and level control to avoid moisture carryover and to support decay heat removal in applicable plant modes.

verification.acceptance: Level control range and inventory management features are defined and support required operating modes.

requirements.text: The SG shall define blowdown requirements (capacity and control) to support chemistry control and impurity removal under normal operation.

verification.acceptance: Blowdown flow and control strategy support chemistry targets and impurity transport assumptions.

requirements.text: The SG shall define maximum allowable primary-to-secondary leakage for normal operation and demonstrate that expected leakage is below the operating limit with margin.

verification.acceptance: Leakage evaluation shows expected leakage below the operating limit with defined margin.

requirements.text: The SG shall define accident leakage assumptions and limits for design basis events and demonstrate that tube integrity criteria support those limits.

verification.acceptance: Accident analyses and tube integrity assessments demonstrate leakage limits are supported.

requirements.text: The SG shall define and verify steam separator/dryer performance (if applicable) to meet moisture carryover limits at rated and bounding conditions.

verification.acceptance: Separator/dryer efficiency analysis or test results meet specified minimum performance.

requirements.text: The SG shall define and verify secondary side blowdown heat recovery performance (if used), including heat exchanger duty and impacts on chemistry control.

verification.acceptance: Heat recovery design meets expected duty and does not compromise chemistry objectives.

requirements.text: The SG design shall define and verify secondary side venting capability to support non-condensable removal during startup and to prevent adverse heat transfer impacts.

verification.acceptance: Venting provisions and capacities are defined and adequate for startup scenarios.

requirements.text: The SG shall define minimum feedwater temperature and flow conditions for stable operation and avoid thermal shocks or stratification that could challenge fatigue limits.

verification.acceptance: Operating limits prevent unacceptable thermal shocks/stratification and are incorporated into procedures.

requirements.text: The SG shall define secondary side water hammer susceptibility and shall include design features and operating limits to mitigate water hammer during transients.

verification.acceptance: Water hammer evaluation completed; mitigation features/limits documented.

requirements.text: The SG shall define performance monitoring parameters and acceptance criteria for on-line trending (e.g., heat transfer efficiency, pressure drops, carryover) to support early detection of degradation.

verification.acceptance: A monitoring parameter list and acceptance criteria are established and integrated into plant monitoring.

requirements.text: The SG shall demonstrate that thermal-hydraulic maldistribution (flow, quality, temperature) is acceptable and does not create localized conditions that accelerate tube wear or corrosion.

verification.acceptance: Design analyses show acceptable distributions and no local exceedances of defined limits.

requirements.text: The SG shall define startup and shutdown operating conditions (including chemistry controls and blowdown strategy) to minimize impurity hideout and reduce risk of localized corrosion during transients.

verification.acceptance: Startup/shutdown guidance exists and is aligned with the chemistry program and SG design assumptions.

requirement_sets.category: 4. Primary pressure boundary integrity and design

requirements.text: The SG primary pressure boundary (tubes, tubesheet, channel head, primary nozzles, welds, and attachments) shall be designed, fabricated, and examined in accordance with the applicable ASME BPVC Section III requirements for the assigned code class.

verification.acceptance: Design specification and code reports demonstrate Section III compliance for the applicable code class.

requirements.text: Primary-side design pressure and temperature shall be specified and used as the basis for sizing and stress analysis of all primary boundary components.

verification.acceptance: Design inputs and calculations use specified primary design pressure/temperature.

requirements.text: Primary boundary allowable stresses, design margins, and load combinations shall be defined and applied consistent with the code of record and licensing basis.

verification.acceptance: Stress reports document allowable stresses and show compliance for all governing load combinations.

requirements.text: Fatigue evaluations for primary boundary components shall consider defined transients/cycles and shall demonstrate cumulative usage factors within allowable limits.

verification.acceptance: Fatigue reports show cumulative usage factors within the defined limits for all evaluated locations.

requirements.text: Fracture toughness and flaw tolerance requirements for primary boundary materials shall be specified and verified, including consideration of service temperature and irradiation effects where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Material specifications include fracture toughness requirements; evaluations show adequate margins.

requirements.text: The tubesheet and channel head design shall ensure adequate separation and sealing between primary and secondary sides, including divider plate region integrity where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Structural/sealing analyses demonstrate separation and sealing integrity for design conditions.

requirements.text: The tube-to-tubesheet joint design (expansion and/or weld) shall be qualified to prevent unacceptable leakage and to withstand design loads and transients.

verification.acceptance: Qualification evidence exists for joint method demonstrating leakage and structural performance.

requirements.text: Primary side cladding materials and thickness (if used) shall be specified and verified to provide corrosion resistance and to maintain integrity under design conditions.

verification.acceptance: Cladding specification and inspection records demonstrate material, thickness, and coverage compliance.

requirements.text: Primary-side nozzle-to-shell and nozzle-to-channel head welds shall be designed and examined to applicable code requirements, with weld maps and NDE records retained.

verification.acceptance: Weld maps and NDE records exist and satisfy the specified exam extent.

requirements.text: Primary boundary bolting, studs, and fasteners (if used) shall meet specified material, heat treatment, and preload requirements and shall be traceable to certified material records.

verification.acceptance: Fastener specifications and CMTRs demonstrate compliance; preload procedures and records exist.

requirements.text: Primary boundary manways and closures shall be designed for pressure, thermal, and cyclic loads, and shall include gasket specifications compatible with primary chemistry and temperatures.

verification.acceptance: Closure design analysis demonstrates compliance; gasket specification is compatible with service.

requirements.text: The SG shall define allowable primary-side leak tightness criteria and shall demonstrate compliance via testing and inspection methods.

verification.acceptance: Leak testing and inspection demonstrate leak tightness within specified limits.

requirements.text: Hydrostatic testing requirements for the primary boundary shall be specified, including test pressure, hold times, instrumentation, and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Hydrotest procedure and records demonstrate test conducted at required pressure and acceptance met.

requirements.text: Primary boundary NDE requirements shall be specified (methods, extent, acceptance standards) and executed in accordance with ASME BPVC Section V and the code of record.

verification.acceptance: NDE procedures are qualified; exam records demonstrate required methods/extent and acceptable results.

requirements.text: Materials used for the primary boundary shall meet ASME BPVC Section II requirements (or approved equivalents) and shall be traceable from receipt through fabrication.

verification.acceptance: Material traceability records and CMTRs demonstrate compliance with specified material requirements.

requirements.text: Primary boundary design shall include consideration of differential thermal expansion between tubes, tubesheet, and shell/channel head, including stress/strain compatibility.

verification.acceptance: Thermal expansion and differential strain analyses show acceptable stresses and deformations.

requirements.text: Primary boundary design shall consider potential vibration and dynamic loads transmitted through tubes and supports, including those associated with flow-induced vibration and seismic events.

verification.acceptance: Dynamic load analyses address governing vibration and seismic combinations with acceptable margins.

requirements.text: The SG primary boundary shall be evaluated for potential erosion, wear, or corrosion at flow discontinuities and shall include design features or inspections to manage identified susceptibilities.

verification.acceptance: Susceptibility evaluation exists and mitigating design/inspection actions are defined.

requirements.text: The SG shall define inspection access and provisions for primary boundary ISI activities applicable to the code class and plant ISI program.

verification.acceptance: ISI access provisions and procedures are compatible with planned inspection methods and frequencies.

requirements.text: Primary boundary weld repairs or modifications shall be controlled under qualified procedures with required examinations and documentation.

verification.acceptance: Repair procedures are qualified and repair records include required examinations and approvals.

requirements.text: The SG design shall define primary side cleaning, flushing, and chemical compatibility requirements prior to initial operation to ensure cleanliness and prevent corrosion.

verification.acceptance: Cleaning/flush requirements and acceptance criteria are specified and verified by records.

requirements.text: The primary boundary shall include provisions to prevent trapped volumes where thermal expansion could cause unacceptable pressure during heatup, or provide analysis demonstrating acceptability.

verification.acceptance: Trapped volume evaluation exists and shows acceptable pressures or includes mitigating provisions.

requirements.text: The SG shall define acceptable primary-side leak detection and response requirements for operations, including criteria for shutdown and evaluation.

verification.acceptance: Leak detection and response criteria are documented in operating procedures and align with leakage limits.

requirements.text: The SG primary boundary design shall include seismic anchorage and interaction checks to prevent loss of function due to seismic-induced displacement or impact.

verification.acceptance: Seismic analyses include anchorage and interaction checks with acceptable margins.

requirements.text: The SG shall provide an as-built tube map and identification scheme that supports tube location traceability for baseline and subsequent inspections, including mapping of special zones (e.g., expansion transition, U-bend, support locations).

verification.acceptance: As-built tube map and identification scheme exist and are suitable for inspection data recording and trending.

requirement_sets.category: 5. Secondary pressure boundary, steam/feedwater systems, and overpressure protection

requirements.text: The SG secondary pressure boundary (shell, steam dome, secondary nozzles, welds, and attachments) shall be designed, fabricated, and examined in accordance with the applicable code of record and assigned code class.

verification.acceptance: Design specification and code reports demonstrate compliance with the code of record for secondary boundary.

requirements.text: Secondary-side design pressure and temperature shall be specified and used as the basis for sizing and stress analysis of all secondary boundary components.

verification.acceptance: Design inputs and calculations use specified secondary design pressure/temperature.

requirements.text: Secondary boundary load combinations shall include pressure, deadweight, thermal, seismic, and dynamic loads such as water hammer and pipe break reactions where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Structural analyses document governing load combinations and demonstrate compliance.

requirements.text: Secondary side overpressure protection setpoints, capacities, and discharge routing shall be specified and shall prevent exceedance of allowable secondary boundary limits for applicable events.

verification.acceptance: Overpressure protection calculations and specifications demonstrate protection for governing events.

requirements.text: Secondary safety/relief valves shall be qualified for required service conditions (pressure, temperature, discharge, and environment) and their settings shall be controlled under configuration management.

verification.acceptance: Qualification records exist; valve settings and tolerances are documented and controlled.

requirements.text: The SG shall define moisture separation and drying features (if applicable) and demonstrate that carryover and water hammer risks are acceptably controlled under operating conditions.

verification.acceptance: Design analysis demonstrates carryover limits and identifies/mitigates water hammer contributors.

requirements.text: Feedwater distribution design shall minimize thermal shocks and stratification and shall promote stable level and heat transfer performance across the operating envelope.

verification.acceptance: Thermal-hydraulic evaluation demonstrates acceptable feedwater distribution and thermal gradients.

requirements.text: The SG shall define secondary side venting and draining design features to support startup, shutdown, hydrotesting, and layup without challenging structural limits or chemistry controls.

verification.acceptance: P&IDs and procedures show adequate vent/drain features and safe operation.

requirements.text: Secondary-side blowdown nozzle and piping interfaces shall be designed to avoid excessive vibration, erosion, or FAC and shall be compatible with blowdown flow ranges.

verification.acceptance: Design evaluation demonstrates acceptable stresses, vibration margins, and erosion/FAC considerations.

requirements.text: Secondary side materials shall be selected considering FAC, corrosion, and erosion mechanisms for expected chemistry and flow conditions.

verification.acceptance: Material selection justification exists and addresses applicable degradation mechanisms.

requirements.text: Secondary boundary weld procedures shall be qualified and executed with required NDE and documentation consistent with the code of record.

verification.acceptance: WPS/PQR qualifications exist; weld records and NDE demonstrate compliance.

requirements.text: Secondary boundary hydrostatic or pneumatic testing requirements shall be specified (as applicable) including test pressure, hold times, and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Test procedures and records demonstrate compliance with specified requirements.

requirements.text: Secondary boundary leak testing requirements shall be specified, including methods and allowable leakage, and shall be performed prior to operation.

verification.acceptance: Leak testing records demonstrate leakage within allowable limits.

requirements.text: Secondary side supports and attachments shall be designed to accommodate thermal expansion and dynamic loads without overstressing the shell or nozzles.

verification.acceptance: Support/attachment analyses demonstrate acceptable stresses and no adverse constraint.

requirements.text: The SG shall define limits and protections to prevent secondary side overfill and to avoid moisture carryover or water slugging to the main steam system.

verification.acceptance: Level control limits and protections are documented and verified as adequate.

requirements.text: The SG shall define secondary side chemistry sampling locations and requirements to ensure representative sampling for control of impurities and corrosion mechanisms.

verification.acceptance: Sampling points and sampling requirements are defined and consistent with chemistry program.

requirements.text: The SG shall define constraints and protections related to secondary side impurities (chloride, sulfate, sodium, oxygen, conductivity) consistent with the chemistry program targets.

verification.acceptance: Chemistry limits and action levels are documented and aligned with chemistry program guidance.

requirements.text: Secondary side layup methods and requirements (wet/dry/nitrogen) shall be specified to minimize corrosion during outages and shutdowns.

verification.acceptance: Layup requirements exist and are compatible with SG materials and plant practices.

requirements.text: Secondary boundary seismic qualification shall demonstrate that the SG maintains pressure boundary integrity and required functions following the SSE for applicable seismic categories.

verification.acceptance: Seismic analyses demonstrate acceptable margins for required functions and boundary integrity.

requirements.text: Secondary boundary design shall consider steam line and feedwater line break loads transmitted to the SG nozzles where applicable to the licensing basis.

verification.acceptance: Dynamic load evaluation exists and includes governing pipe break scenarios as applicable.

requirements.text: The SG shall define secondary side cleaning provisions and limitations (including chemical cleaning compatibility if used) to manage deposits and maintain performance.

verification.acceptance: Cleaning provisions and limitations are defined and compatible with materials and chemistry program.

requirements.text: The SG shall define requirements for inspection access to secondary side features (support plates, tubesheet top, sludge pile region) to support maintenance and deposit management activities.

verification.acceptance: Access provisions support intended inspection/cleaning activities and are documented.

requirements.text: Secondary boundary design shall include provisions to prevent or mitigate trapped volumes and associated overpressurization during heatup or valve alignment evolutions.

verification.acceptance: Trapped volume analysis exists and mitigating features/limits are defined.

requirements.text: The SG shall define functional requirements for secondary side pressure control and coordination with turbine bypass or relief systems where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Pressure control and coordination requirements are documented and integrated into plant control design.

requirements.text: The SG shall define acceptance criteria for secondary side performance indicators (carryover, blowdown chemistry, pressure drop) and integrate these into operating monitoring and trending.

verification.acceptance: Monitoring/trending plan includes defined indicators with acceptance criteria and corrective action triggers.

requirement_sets.category: 6. Tube bundle configuration, supports, and clearances

requirements.text: The tube bundle layout (tube count, pitch, arrangement) shall be specified and shall support required heat transfer area while maintaining structural integrity and inspectability.

verification.acceptance: Design documentation defines layout and demonstrates required area and structural adequacy.

requirements.text: Tube support plate (TSP) or support structure type, spacing, and materials shall be specified to control tube vibration, maintain clearances, and permit inspection.

verification.acceptance: Support design documents define type/spacing/materials and demonstrate adequacy.

requirements.text: The SG shall define allowable tube-to-support clearances and manufacturing tolerances to limit fretting and provide stable vibration response.

verification.acceptance: Clearance requirements and tolerances are specified; as-built inspections verify compliance.

requirements.text: Anti-vibration bar (AVB) design (if used) shall be specified for the U-bend region, including geometry, spacing, and gap limits to control vibration and wear.

verification.acceptance: AVB design and gap limits are specified and supported by FIV analysis.

requirements.text: U-bend region support strategy shall be specified, including AVB coverage and support adequacy for all U-bend rows susceptible to fluid elastic instability or turbulence-induced vibration.

verification.acceptance: FIV analysis demonstrates stability for U-bend rows and identifies support adequacy.

requirements.text: For once-through SGs, tube support and baffle design shall control vibration and thermal expansion across economizer/evaporator regions, including support in high-quality flow regions.

verification.acceptance: FIV and structural analyses demonstrate support adequacy for once-through configuration.

requirements.text: For helical-coil SGs, coil support and restraint design shall accommodate thermal expansion and seismic loads while preventing excessive coil motion and wear.

verification.acceptance: Structural and dynamic analyses demonstrate support adequacy for helical coils.

requirements.text: Tube-to-tube and tube-to-structure minimum clearances shall be specified to prevent contact under design load combinations including thermal expansion and seismic displacement.

verification.acceptance: Clearance analyses and as-built checks demonstrate minimum clearances are maintained.

requirements.text: The tube bundle shall be designed to avoid resonance with primary/secondary flow excitation over the operating envelope, considering uncertainties and manufacturing tolerances.

verification.acceptance: Modal and excitation analyses demonstrate acceptable separation from resonance conditions.

requirements.text: Tube supports shall be designed to limit wear rates such that predicted wear depth remains below defined limits for the inspection interval under bounding conditions.

verification.acceptance: Wear prediction demonstrates wear depth below limit over inspection interval with margin.

requirements.text: The tube bundle shall include design features to minimize sludge pile formation at the tubesheet and to facilitate deposit management (e.g., flow paths, lancing lanes) where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Design features supporting deposit management are documented and compatible with planned cleaning methods.

requirements.text: Tube support structure shall be designed to minimize crevice volumes and stagnant regions that can concentrate impurities and promote corrosion at tube/support interfaces.

verification.acceptance: Design evaluation addresses crevice/stagnant region minimization and impurity concentration mechanisms.

requirements.text: Tube support plate drilling/broaching patterns shall be designed to provide adequate flow distribution while controlling tube vibration and avoiding unacceptable local velocities.

verification.acceptance: Thermal-hydraulic and FIV analyses demonstrate acceptable flow distribution and vibration margins.

requirements.text: The SG shall define tube end conditions and transition regions (e.g., expansion transitions) and evaluate susceptibility to stress corrosion cracking and wear at these locations.

verification.acceptance: Susceptibility evaluation exists and mitigation/inspection requirements are defined.

requirements.text: Tubesheet top-of-tubesheet (TTS) region design shall address flow and chemistry conditions associated with sludge deposition and corrosion mechanisms, with appropriate inspection focus.

verification.acceptance: Design evaluation addresses TTS conditions and defines inspection/cleaning focus as needed.

requirements.text: The SG shall define tube plugging/sleeving impacts on thermal performance and flow distribution and ensure acceptable operation at the plugging limit.

verification.acceptance: Performance model includes plugging impacts and demonstrates acceptable operation at plugging limit.

requirements.text: The SG shall define a tube identification system (row/column or equivalent) that supports unambiguous recording and trending of inspection indications and repairs.

verification.acceptance: Tube ID system is defined and used consistently in inspection/repair records.

requirements.text: The SG shall define and control tube bundle dimensional tolerances (pitch, straightness, ovality) that affect heat transfer, vibration response, and inspectability.

verification.acceptance: Dimensional tolerance requirements exist; as-built inspection records demonstrate compliance.

requirements.text: The SG shall define requirements for tube surface finish and cleanliness to minimize initiation sites for corrosion and to support NDE signal quality.

verification.acceptance: Surface finish/cleanliness requirements are specified and verified by inspection records.

requirements.text: The SG shall provide provisions to support foreign object search and retrieval (FOSAR) in regions susceptible to loose parts accumulation and tube wear.

verification.acceptance: Access and tooling provisions for FOSAR are defined and feasible for planned outages.

requirements.text: The SG shall define secondary-side deposit management access points and flow paths to support sludge lancing effectiveness and coverage.

verification.acceptance: Lancing access points and coverage assumptions are documented and achievable.

requirements.text: Where chemical cleaning is planned, the tube bundle and internals design shall be evaluated for chemical compatibility and flow distribution to avoid stagnant zones during cleaning evolutions.

verification.acceptance: Cleaning compatibility and flow distribution evaluation exists and includes acceptance limits.

requirements.text: The SG shall define design requirements for tube support wear monitoring zones and shall align NDE techniques to detect degradation mechanisms expected at those supports.

verification.acceptance: Inspection scope and techniques are aligned to expected mechanisms for each zone.

requirements.text: The SG tube bundle shall be evaluated for seismic-induced tube/support contact and wear, including potential for increased wear due to support gaps under SSE conditions.

verification.acceptance: Seismic interaction analysis addresses tube/support contact and demonstrates acceptable margins.

requirements.text: The SG shall define acceptance criteria for as-built tube support gap measurements and shall establish corrective actions if gaps exceed design limits.

verification.acceptance: Acceptance criteria and corrective action process exist; as-built data shows compliance or documented dispositions.

requirement_sets.category: 7. Materials selection, compatibility, and corrosion control

requirements.text: Tube material selection shall be justified based on resistance to known SG tube degradation mechanisms (e.g., SCC, pitting, fretting wear) for the defined chemistry and operating conditions.

verification.acceptance: Material selection basis addresses expected degradation mechanisms and demonstrates suitability.

requirements.text: Tube material and product form shall meet specified ASME Section II requirements (or approved equivalents) including mechanical properties, chemistry limits, and heat treatment controls.

verification.acceptance: Material specifications and CMTRs demonstrate compliance with required properties and heat treatment.

requirements.text: Tube support plate and internals materials shall be selected to minimize galvanic coupling and crevice corrosion at tube/support interfaces and to maintain compatibility with cleaning processes.

verification.acceptance: Material compatibility evaluation exists, including galvanic and crevice corrosion considerations.

requirements.text: Primary side materials (channel head, divider plate, cladding) shall be selected for compatibility with primary coolant chemistry and temperature, including resistance to corrosion and erosion.

verification.acceptance: Compatibility evaluation exists and material specifications reflect required corrosion resistance.

requirements.text: Secondary side materials (shell, steam dome, nozzles) shall be selected considering FAC susceptibility, corrosion, and erosion for expected flow and chemistry conditions.

verification.acceptance: Material selection basis addresses FAC/corrosion/erosion mechanisms and mitigations.

requirements.text: The SG secondary chemistry program shall define target pH, oxygen control, and impurity limits (chloride, sulfate, sodium, conductivity) and shall establish action levels and corrective actions.

verification.acceptance: Chemistry program documents targets, limits, action levels, and response actions.

requirements.text: The SG design and program shall include controls to limit chloride concentration to the specified limit under normal operation and during transients, including monitoring and response actions.

verification.acceptance: Chloride monitoring and response actions are defined and support the specified limit.

requirements.text: The SG design and program shall include controls to limit sulfate concentration to the specified limit under normal operation and during transients, including monitoring and response actions.

verification.acceptance: Sulfate monitoring and response actions are defined and support the specified limit.

requirements.text: The SG chemistry program shall define sodium and conductivity limits and shall include monitoring that is sufficiently sensitive to detect condenser leaks or contaminant ingress.

verification.acceptance: Sodium/conductivity limits and monitoring sensitivity are defined and implemented.

requirements.text: The SG chemistry program shall define dissolved oxygen limits and control methods to minimize corrosion and FAC in secondary systems.

verification.acceptance: Oxygen limits and control methods are defined and implemented in chemistry procedures.

requirements.text: Iron and copper transport limits and monitoring shall be defined to control deposition and fouling in the SG and to manage corrosion product transport.

verification.acceptance: Transport limits and monitoring approach are defined and used for trending and corrective actions.

requirements.text: The SG design shall consider impurity hideout and hideout return behavior and define monitoring and operating guidance to mitigate concentration in crevices and deposits.

verification.acceptance: Hideout/hideout return considerations are addressed and operating guidance is defined.

requirements.text: The SG shall define deposit management strategies (blowdown, lancing, chemical cleaning) consistent with expected deposition rates and operating experience for the plant design.

verification.acceptance: Deposit management strategy exists and is aligned with chemistry program and design features.

requirements.text: Where sludge lancing is used, the SG design and program shall define lancing frequency and effectiveness targets, and shall include acceptance criteria for deposit removal.

verification.acceptance: Lancing plan includes frequency, targets, and acceptance criteria with records of execution.

requirements.text: Where chemical cleaning is planned or possible, the SG materials, internals, and welds shall be evaluated for chemical compatibility, including potential adverse effects on protective films.

verification.acceptance: Chemical compatibility evaluation exists and defines allowable chemistries and exposure limits.

requirements.text: Tube and internals surface condition requirements (oxide film, roughness, cleanliness) shall be defined to reduce initiation of corrosion and to support reliable NDE.

verification.acceptance: Surface condition requirements exist and are verified during fabrication and maintenance.

requirements.text: The SG program shall define requirements for control of copper contamination sources and mitigation actions if copper transport exceeds limits.

verification.acceptance: Copper source controls and mitigation actions are defined and tracked.

requirements.text: The SG design shall incorporate materials and design features to mitigate stress corrosion cracking mechanisms at known susceptible locations (e.g., expansion transitions, tube support crevices).

verification.acceptance: Design and material choices address susceptible locations and include mitigation/inspection strategies.

requirements.text: Tube plugging and repair materials (plugs, sleeves, stabilizers) shall be compatible with tube material and operating environments and shall be qualified for the intended service life.

verification.acceptance: Repair component material compatibility and qualification evidence exists.

requirements.text: Gaskets and sealing materials used in SG manways and channel head closures shall be compatible with service fluids, temperatures, and radiation environment as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Gasket specifications demonstrate compatibility and include material certifications.

requirements.text: Corrosion allowances or protective measures shall be specified for secondary side carbon steel surfaces susceptible to FAC or corrosion, including inspection/monitoring requirements.

verification.acceptance: FAC/corrosion management measures are defined and supported by analysis and monitoring plans.

requirements.text: The SG shall define requirements for control of chlorides and halides during fabrication, cleaning, and layup to prevent initiation of corrosion and SCC.

verification.acceptance: Procedures define halide controls and records demonstrate compliance.

requirements.text: The SG shall define requirements for secondary side crevice management (e.g., tube support crevices, tubesheet crevices) including monitoring, cleaning, and inspection focus.

verification.acceptance: Crevice management actions are documented and integrated into maintenance/inspection plans.

requirements.text: The SG shall define requirements for material traceability and positive material identification (PMI) where appropriate to prevent material mix-ups for pressure boundary and critical internals.

verification.acceptance: Traceability and PMI requirements exist and are implemented with records.

requirements.text: The SG design and program shall define acceptance criteria for corrosion product deposition indicators (e.g., fouling factor, pressure drop changes) and actions when indicators exceed thresholds.

verification.acceptance: Trending indicators and action thresholds are defined and incorporated into plant monitoring.

requirement_sets.category: 8. Fabrication, welding, cleanliness, assembly, and factory testing

requirements.text: SG fabrication shall be performed under an approved quality program meeting applicable nuclear QA requirements, including document control, training, and calibrated measurement systems.

verification.acceptance: Quality program evidence demonstrates compliance and includes audits, training records, and calibration controls.

requirements.text: Welding procedures for pressure boundary welds shall be qualified in accordance with ASME Section IX and the code of record, and welder qualifications shall be current for the scope of work.

verification.acceptance: WPS/PQR and welder qualification records demonstrate compliance for required welds.

requirements.text: NDE procedures shall be qualified and performed in accordance with ASME Section V (and applicable code requirements), with acceptance standards defined and records retained.

verification.acceptance: NDE procedures/qualifications and records demonstrate required coverage and acceptable results.

requirements.text: Fabrication travelers and hold points shall be established for critical steps including tube expansion/welding, pressure boundary closures, and final cleanliness verification.

verification.acceptance: Travelers identify hold points; completed records show required sign-offs and inspections.

requirements.text: Material receiving inspection shall verify material identification, CMTRs, heat numbers, and required properties prior to release for fabrication.

verification.acceptance: Receiving inspection records demonstrate verification and traceability.

requirements.text: Tube expansion or welding processes (as applicable) shall be qualified, including process parameters, pullout strength/leak tightness, and effects on tube properties.

verification.acceptance: Process qualification records demonstrate acceptable joint performance and controlled parameters.

requirements.text: Tube bundle assembly shall control foreign material and debris, including documented FME controls and inspections prior to bundle closure.

verification.acceptance: FME controls and inspections are documented and show acceptable condition prior to closure.

requirements.text: Cleanliness requirements for primary and secondary wetted surfaces shall be specified (particulate, oils/grease, chlorides/halides) and verified before shipment.

verification.acceptance: Cleanliness specification exists; verification records demonstrate compliance.

requirements.text: Post-weld heat treatment (PWHT) requirements (if applicable) shall be specified and controlled, including temperature/time records and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: PWHT records demonstrate compliance with specified parameters and acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Dimensional inspections shall verify critical dimensions and tolerances including nozzle orientations, support locations, manway geometry, and tube support gaps where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Dimensional inspection records demonstrate compliance with design tolerances.

requirements.text: Pressure boundary hydrostatic tests shall be performed per the code of record, including documented test pressure, hold time, temperature, and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Hydrotest records demonstrate compliance and no unacceptable leakage or deformation.

requirements.text: Leak testing shall be performed using the specified method and acceptance criteria, including verification of test equipment calibration and sensitivity.

verification.acceptance: Leak test records demonstrate method, calibration, sensitivity, and acceptable results.

requirements.text: Factory acceptance tests shall include verification of instrumentation functionality, calibration, and signal integrity for SG-installed sensors and transmitters where provided.

verification.acceptance: FAT records demonstrate functional checks, calibration, and acceptable results.

requirements.text: Baseline preservice eddy current testing (ECT) shall be performed when required by the tube integrity program, including probe selection, calibration, and data archiving.

verification.acceptance: ECT baseline data package exists, is complete, and meets program requirements.

requirements.text: Tube maps, weld maps, NDE summaries, and as-built documentation shall be compiled in the vendor data package and delivered in controlled formats suitable for lifetime data management.

verification.acceptance: Data package includes required maps/records and meets delivery and configuration control requirements.

requirements.text: Handling, lifting, and shipping protection features shall be verified prior to shipment, including verification of lift points, restraints, and environmental controls.

verification.acceptance: Shipment readiness checklist and inspections verify lift/shipping protections are in place.

requirements.text: Preservation measures shall be implemented to prevent corrosion and contamination during storage and shipment, including humidity control and protective covers where required.

verification.acceptance: Preservation requirements are implemented; receiving inspections show acceptable condition.

requirements.text: A receiving inspection plan shall be defined for site receipt of the SG, including checks for shipping damage, preservation status, cleanliness, and documentation completeness.

verification.acceptance: Receiving inspection plan exists and acceptance records demonstrate completion.

requirements.text: Installation requirements shall define alignment tolerances, support/anchorage installation, and required inspections prior to system turnover.

verification.acceptance: Installation procedures define tolerances and inspections; records demonstrate compliance.

requirements.text: Field welds and closures (if any) shall be performed under qualified procedures with required examinations and documentation consistent with the code of record.

verification.acceptance: Field weld records include WPS, welder qualifications, NDE, and acceptance evidence.

requirements.text: Post-installation hydro/leak tests (as required) shall be performed with defined acceptance criteria prior to initial operation or return to service.

verification.acceptance: Post-installation test records demonstrate compliance with specified requirements.

requirements.text: Factory or site flushing/cleaning shall be performed to achieve specified cleanliness levels prior to operation, with documented acceptance criteria and records.

verification.acceptance: Flushing/cleaning records demonstrate cleanliness acceptance criteria are met.

requirements.text: Deviation requests affecting SG design or fabrication shall include technical evaluation, impact assessment on tube integrity and performance, and required approvals prior to implementation.

verification.acceptance: Deviation records include evaluations, approvals, and closure evidence.

requirements.text: Quality records for SG fabrication and testing shall be compiled, reviewed, and accepted prior to shipment or turnover, including closure of open items and dispositions.

verification.acceptance: Records package is complete; open items are resolved or formally deferred with controls.

requirements.text: Fabrication processes that could introduce residual stresses or cold work in tubes (e.g., expansion, bending) shall be controlled and evaluated for effects on corrosion susceptibility.

verification.acceptance: Process controls and evaluations address residual stress/cold work and associated susceptibility.

requirement_sets.category: 9. Tube integrity program: inspection, assessment, repair, and plugging

requirements.text: A steam generator tube integrity program shall be established consistent with applicable program guidance, defining roles, responsibilities, scope, and commitments.

verification.acceptance: Tube integrity program documentation exists and aligns with applicable guidance and commitments.

requirements.text: The tube integrity program shall define performance criteria for structural integrity and accident-induced leakage consistent with licensing basis requirements.

verification.acceptance: Performance criteria are defined and traceable to licensing basis requirements and analyses.

requirements.text: Baseline preservice tube inspections shall be performed as specified, with data archived to support future comparisons and trending.

verification.acceptance: Baseline inspection dataset is complete, quality-checked, and archived for retrieval.

requirements.text: The program shall define inspection intervals and scope, including criteria for full-bundle or sample inspections based on degradation mechanisms and risk.

verification.acceptance: Inspection interval and scope basis is documented and includes mechanism/risk considerations.

requirements.text: Inspection technique selection (bobbin, rotating probe, array) shall be justified for expected degradation mechanisms and shall include qualification of detection/ sizing performance.

verification.acceptance: Technique selection and qualification records exist and demonstrate capability for expected mechanisms.

requirements.text: Data acquisition and analysis procedures for ECT shall include calibration, analyst qualification, data quality checks, and independent review requirements as appropriate.

verification.acceptance: ECT procedures include required controls; records show analyst qualification and independent reviews.

requirements.text: The program shall define plugging criteria for degraded tubes, including degradation-specific structural limits and leakage considerations.

verification.acceptance: Plugging criteria are defined for applicable mechanisms and are under configuration control.

requirements.text: The program shall define sleeve repair criteria and qualification requirements where sleeving is used, including structural and leakage performance for the remaining service life.

verification.acceptance: Sleeving criteria and qualification requirements exist and include acceptance criteria for remaining life.

requirements.text: Tube repair methods (plugs, sleeves, stabilizers) shall be qualified for the applicable tube material, environment, and loading, with documentation retained for life-of-plant.

verification.acceptance: Qualification reports demonstrate repair performance for applicable conditions and include records retention.

requirements.text: Structural integrity assessments shall demonstrate adequate margin to burst or rupture for all inspected tubes, including consideration of uncertainty, sizing errors, and growth rates.

verification.acceptance: Integrity assessments document margins and address uncertainties and growth assumptions.

requirements.text: Accident-induced leakage assessments shall demonstrate that predicted leakage remains within accident leakage limits, including consideration of multiple tube failures where applicable to the licensing basis.

verification.acceptance: Leakage assessments demonstrate compliance with accident leakage limits and address applicable assumptions.

requirements.text: Operational assessment and condition monitoring processes shall be defined and implemented for each inspection outage, including identification of active degradation mechanisms.

verification.acceptance: OA/CM reports exist for each inspection and include mechanism identification and results.

requirements.text: Tube degradation growth rate models shall be established and updated using plant-specific data and operating experience to support operational assessments and inspection planning.

verification.acceptance: Growth rate models are documented, updated, and traceable to data and assumptions.

requirements.text: The program shall define criteria for expansion of inspection scope (e.g., additional tube rows, additional regions) based on findings and susceptibility assessments.

verification.acceptance: Scope expansion criteria are documented and applied when triggers are met.

requirements.text: Inspection reporting shall include tube location, indication type, size, confidence, analyst notes, and repair disposition; records shall support trending and repeatability.

verification.acceptance: Inspection reports contain required fields and are suitable for trending across outages.

requirements.text: The program shall define foreign object search and retrieval (FOSAR) criteria and processes to minimize tube wear events caused by loose parts, including documentation of retrievals.

verification.acceptance: FOSAR process and criteria exist; retrieval records and disposition documentation are maintained.

requirements.text: The program shall define wear and fretting evaluation methods, including wear depth limits and corrective actions if wear approaches limits.

verification.acceptance: Wear evaluation method and limits are defined and applied with documented corrective actions.

requirements.text: The program shall define tube plugging limit and evaluate impacts on safety and performance at the plugging limit, including consideration of margin to additional plugging.

verification.acceptance: Evaluation demonstrates acceptable safety/performance at plugging limit and defines remaining margin.

requirements.text: The program shall define requirements for tube leak monitoring and action thresholds during operation, including criteria for power reduction, shutdown, and engineering evaluation.

verification.acceptance: Leak monitoring and response thresholds are defined in operating procedures and align with program commitments.

requirements.text: The program shall define requirements for inspection of repaired tubes (plugs/sleeves/stabilizers) and verification of repair integrity over time.

verification.acceptance: Repair inspection requirements and acceptance criteria are defined and implemented.

requirements.text: The program shall define data management requirements for tube integrity, including secure storage, traceability, data formats, and ability to reproduce past analyses.

verification.acceptance: Data management requirements are documented; controls support traceability and reproducibility.

requirements.text: Where risk-informed inspection approaches are used, the basis shall be documented and include consideration of degradation mechanisms, consequences, and defense-in-depth.

verification.acceptance: Risk-informed basis documentation exists and is reviewed/approved under configuration control.

requirements.text: The program shall define criteria and processes for disposition of ambiguous indications and shall include conservative assumptions or follow-up examinations as needed.

verification.acceptance: Disposition process exists; records show follow-up exams or conservative treatment where required.

requirements.text: The program shall define requirements for trending of degradation by region (hot leg/cold leg, U-bend, TTS, support plates) to support targeted mitigation actions.

verification.acceptance: Trending reports are produced by region and used to plan mitigation/inspection actions.

requirements.text: Program changes affecting tube integrity performance criteria, inspection scope, or repair criteria shall be evaluated for licensing basis impact and controlled through configuration management.

verification.acceptance: Change evaluations and approvals are documented and include licensing basis impact assessment.

requirement_sets.category: 10. Flow-induced vibration, stability, and wear/fretting control

requirements.text: The SG shall include a flow-induced vibration (FIV) design basis identifying primary excitation sources, potential vibration mechanisms, and applicable evaluation methods.

verification.acceptance: FIV design basis document exists and identifies excitation sources and evaluation approach.

requirements.text: The tube bundle shall be evaluated for fluid elastic instability (FEI) and shall demonstrate stability margins at rated and bounding flow conditions with uncertainty considerations.

verification.acceptance: FEI evaluation demonstrates stability ratio below the specified limit with uncertainty accounted for.

requirements.text: Tube support and AVB designs shall be evaluated for sensitivity to support gaps and tolerances, including worst-case gap combinations.

verification.acceptance: Sensitivity studies demonstrate acceptable stability and wear margins for worst-case gaps.

requirements.text: The SG shall define acceptable wear depth limits for tube wear mechanisms and ensure predicted wear remains below limits for the inspection interval with margin.

verification.acceptance: Wear projections remain below defined wear depth limits with margin for the inspection interval.

requirements.text: The SG shall define acceptable wear rate limits and shall establish evaluation criteria if measured or predicted wear rates exceed limits.

verification.acceptance: Wear rate limits and evaluation criteria are documented and used in integrity assessments.

requirements.text: The FIV evaluation shall include tube modal properties, damping assumptions, and mode shapes appropriate to the SG configuration and support design.

verification.acceptance: Modal analysis documentation includes damping basis and mode shapes consistent with configuration.

requirements.text: The FIV evaluation shall consider turbulence-induced vibration, vortex shedding, and acoustic excitation where applicable to the geometry and flow regime.

verification.acceptance: Evaluation addresses applicable excitation mechanisms and demonstrates acceptable response.

requirements.text: For U-tube SGs, U-bend region vibration shall be evaluated considering two-phase effects and AVB effectiveness, including potential for out-of-plane motion and wear.

verification.acceptance: U-bend vibration evaluation includes two-phase considerations and demonstrates acceptable wear margins.

requirements.text: For once-through SGs, high-quality flow regions shall be evaluated for vibration and wear risks, including support effectiveness in regions with strong two-phase excitation.

verification.acceptance: Once-through vibration evaluation addresses two-phase excitation and demonstrates acceptable response.

requirements.text: For helical-coil SGs, coil vibration and support interaction shall be evaluated under single- and two-phase conditions and seismic excitations where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Helical coil vibration evaluation demonstrates acceptable response and support interaction under bounding conditions.

requirements.text: Tube-to-support contact forces and wear mechanisms (fretting, impact) shall be evaluated, including estimation of contact work rate and wear coefficients where used.

verification.acceptance: Contact force/work rate evaluation supports wear predictions and identifies controlling locations.

requirements.text: The FIV evaluation shall include uncertainty treatment for flow conditions, damping, support gaps, and material properties and shall show robustness to uncertainties.

verification.acceptance: Uncertainty treatment is documented and demonstrates adequate margins across uncertainties.

requirements.text: The SG design shall incorporate design features to mitigate loose part induced wear, including foreign object barriers, flow paths, and retrieval accessibility as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Design features and accessibility provisions are documented and support mitigation strategy.

requirements.text: The SG shall define acceptance criteria for as-built measurements affecting vibration (support gaps, AVB gaps, TSP alignment) and shall require corrective actions for out-of-tolerance conditions.

verification.acceptance: Acceptance criteria exist; as-built measurement records show compliance or dispositions.

requirements.text: Where vibration testing or benchmarking is performed, test conditions and acceptance criteria shall be defined and results shall be used to validate analysis assumptions where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Benchmark/test results are documented and used to validate/adjust analysis assumptions.

requirements.text: The SG tube integrity assessment shall incorporate FIV-related degradation mechanisms and shall align inspection focus to regions of highest vibration/wear susceptibility.

verification.acceptance: Integrity assessment integrates FIV susceptibility and inspection scope addresses high-risk regions.

requirements.text: Operational parameters that influence vibration (flow rates, levels, pressure) shall be monitored or bounded by operating limits to maintain analyzed vibration margins.

verification.acceptance: Operating limits/monitoring parameters are defined and consistent with analyzed bounds.

requirements.text: The SG shall define actions and evaluation requirements when tube wear is identified trending toward limits, including scope expansion, mitigation, or repair.

verification.acceptance: Procedures define triggers and actions; evaluation requirements are documented.

requirements.text: Seismic-induced vibration and tube/support interaction shall be evaluated where seismic category requires, including consideration of increased contact forces and wear.

verification.acceptance: Seismic interaction evaluation demonstrates acceptable margins or identifies mitigations.

requirements.text: The SG design shall minimize excitation from secondary side flow distribution features (e.g., feedring jets) that could induce localized vibration hot-spots.

verification.acceptance: Flow distribution evaluation identifies and mitigates potential vibration hot-spots.

requirements.text: Tube support designs shall consider potential for wear at tube support plate intersections due to out-of-plane motion and shall define inspection techniques to detect wear at these locations.

verification.acceptance: Inspection techniques and reporting requirements address support plate wear locations.

requirements.text: The SG shall define acceptance criteria for vibration-related performance indicators (e.g., loose part counts, wear findings) and shall integrate them into corrective action processes.

verification.acceptance: Indicators and thresholds are defined and trigger corrective action evaluations when exceeded.

requirements.text: The FIV program shall define recordkeeping for analyses, assumptions, as-built gap measurements, and updates due to modifications or plugging/repair changes.

verification.acceptance: Records exist and are controlled; updates are documented and traceable.

requirements.text: Changes that alter flow distribution or support conditions (e.g., plugging patterns, modifications) shall be evaluated for FIV impacts prior to implementation.

verification.acceptance: Change evaluations address FIV impacts and are approved before implementation.

requirements.text: The SG design and program shall define integration between foreign object management and FIV/wear management, including requirements for retrieval priority based on susceptibility regions.

verification.acceptance: Integrated guidance exists linking FOSAR actions to susceptibility and wear risk.
